meanings.definition: Translations or paraphrases of the dialogue or lyrics of a foreign-language performance, projected above the stage.
meanings.sent1: During the opera, the surtitles helped the audience understand the foreign language lyrics.
meanings.sent2: The surtitles for the play were clear and easy to read from any seat in the theater.
meanings.sent3: The surtitles decided to take a break and show emojis instead of translations, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The surtitles floated above the stage like colorful clouds of language, guiding the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The surtitles shone brightly, illuminating the words for all to see clearly.

meanings.definition: Subtitles projected above a stage or displayed on a screen, providing translations or paraphrases of the dialogue or lyrics of a foreign-language performance.
meanings.sent1: The surtitles at the concert made it easier for everyone to follow the foreign lyrics.
meanings.sent2: Audiences appreciate surtitles as they make foreign-language performances more accessible.
meanings.sent3: The surtitles decided to play a game of hide and seek, popping up at unexpected moments.
meanings.sent4: The surtitles danced across the screen, bringing the words to life in a magical way.
meanings.sent5: The surtitles acted as helpful guides, leading the audience through the language maze.
